availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York City, New York County, New York

body.p:
EDWARD BISSELL,
NOTARY PUBLIC OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK,
AND
Commissioner of Deeds, &c.
OF
Alabama,
Arkansas,
California,
Connecticut,
Delaware,
Florida,
Georgia,
Illinois,
Indiana,
Iowa,
Kansas,
Kentucky,
Louisiana,
Maine,
Maryland,
Massachusetts,
Michigan,
Minnesota,
Mississippi,
Missouri,
Nebraska,
New Hampshire
New Jersey,
New Mexico,
New York,
North Carolina,
Ohio,
Oregon,
Pennsylvalnia,
Rhode Island,
South Carolina,
Tennessee,
Texas,
Utah,
Virginia,
Vermont,
Washington,
Wisconsin.

{☞ Ex-officio Commissioner of the Canadas, and other British North America, East and West India Possessions, Mexico, and all other South American Republics and States, and all the French, and other European Possessions.}

{U. S. PASSPORTS issued with Dispatch, by E. Bissell.
N. B. -- Naturalized Citizens must bring with them their Naturalization Certificate.}

☞ Commercial claims on Debtors, in ALL States and Territories, certified for collection.
N. B. -- E. BISSELL takes Depositions and Acknowledgments for, and executes special Commissions from other States, &c. to take Testimony here, with care, promptness and accuracy.

☞ Powers of Attorney, Deeds, Wills, Bonds and Mortgages; Co-Partnership Agreements, and all other Contracts and Writings, legally and neatly drawn and authenticated, by EDW'D BISSELL, Lawyer.
N. B. -- All kinds of Claims on the U. S. Government prosecuted, collected, or purchased, by E. B.

☞ Is constantly in his office, daily, from 9 A. M. until 5 P. M.
N. B. -- CHARGES MODERATE, and always lawful.

OFFICE -- No. 271 Broadway, Corner of Chambers Street,
Room No. 8, First Floor over Shoe and Leather Bank, New York City.
